subject: Cooking
title: Temperature Perception and Flavor
description: A short lesson to help you apply Temperature Perception and Flavor.

hook.text: Ice cream tastes sweeter at room temperature. Cold suppresses sweetness ‚Äî that's why it's loaded with sugar.

buildup.text: Taste receptors are temperature-sensitive. Cold numbs them, reducing perception of sweet and salty flavors.

discovery.text: This is why melted ice cream tastes sickeningly sweet ‚Äî you finally detect the actual sugar content.

twist.text: Warm foods release more volatile aroma compounds, making them smell and taste more intensely flavored.

climax.text: Soup must be saltier than a cold salad dressing to taste equally seasoned ‚Äî heat changes everything.

punchline.text: Temperature isn't just how food feels. It changes how food tastes.

quiz.question: Why does melted ice cream taste much sweeter than frozen?
options: Cold numbs taste receptors for sweetness
